entry.title: Skull and Bones to sail the waters of Steam in August
entry.summary:
After five months of sailing the seas of Ubisoft Connect, Skull and Bones is getting ready to make sail for Steam in August. Nautical puns.
Ubisoft announced today that its live-service piracy game Skull and Bones will be available for Steam on August 22, 2024. The game will include its base adventure, in which you work with scheming pirate lords and gain notoriety in a world of outlaws. Skull and Bones also includes two free seasons worth of content, with two more arriving soon.
Skull and Bones seeks new horizons with a Steam launch
For those who have the game on Ubisoft Connect, the publisher has confirmed that any progress will transfer. Of course, cross-progress is a given, since most Ubisoft games require an Ubisoft Account to even run.
For those who decide to transfer over to Steam, all your story progress and unlocked content will come alongside. The issue will be that you'll have to purchase the game once again unless you've been playing the game via Ubisoft Plus, the company's monthly subscription service.
Screenshot by Destructoid
Those deciding to jump ship should also be pleased to note that the game is indeed supported by crossplay. If you still want to sail with friends on Ubisoft Connect or console platforms, the Steam version shouldn't ground your efforts.
Skull and Bones has seen its fair share of choppy waters. The game was in development hell for many years, held back by delay after delay. The end result was a a fairly decent piracy game, with our own Steven Mills saying it's "great for rather mindless fun, but don't expect anything too intricate."
I also enjoyed the game more than expected as I sailed its churning seas on ships with weird names. Skull and Bones may not be the multiplayer Black Flag of promise, but it has some charms.

entry.title: How to get workshop maps in Rocket League
entry.summary:
Rocket League, the free-to-play game featuring football with cars, has been around since 2015. While the game constantly receives new content in the form of obtainable items via new seasons, there are limited maps to engage yourself in Rocket League.
However, players can also enjoy custom maps in Rocket League, which are made by the game‚Äôs community. These maps are primarily designed to offer new challenges to players, which can help them improve their skills in Rocket League, and offer a new experience.
These custom maps are also referred to as Workshop maps, given that they are available for PC players through the Steam Workshop page for Rocket League. If you are looking to try out workshop maps in Rocket League, here‚Äôs how you can get them.
How to get workshop maps in Rocket League
Go to the Rocket League library page on Steam.
Click on the Workshop tab.
Browse the variety of maps available and select the one you like.
To download the map, click on the Subscribe button on the workshop page of the map.
How to access workshop maps in Rocket League
Start Rocket League on your PC.
Click Play, and choose the Offline playlist.
Go to Custom Games and select Workshop.
Choose any of the downloaded maps.
Given that the Workshop maps are available only through Steam, this means that console players cannot download or access the map. Also note that these maps are not supported for multiplayer gaming natively in the game, but you can refer to this guide which can help you set up how to play with friends in Workshop maps.
You can uninstall a workshop map for Rocket League by going to the Steam Workshop page, clicking the ‚ÄúYour Files‚Äù dropdown, and choosing ‚ÄúSubscribed Items‚Äù. Click ‚ÄúUnsubscribe‚Äù on any map you want to remove.

entry.title: How to play Fall Guys in Fortnite with the 30.30 update
entry.summary:
The Fortnite x Fall Guys collaboration has officially begun its first stages, with Fall Guys skins and maps available to explore. However, one way to play Fall Guys early before the v30.40 update on August 6 is by creating and playing maps through Fortnite's Creative mode.
How to play Fall Guys in Fortnite 30.30
Playing Fall Guys in Fortnite in v30.30 requires creating a Fall Guys island through the Unreal Editor (UEFN) or Creative mode. While UEFN is a PC-exclusive program that enables you to design Fortnite experiences, Creative is a mode directly in Fortnite that that allows you to create maps.
Generally speaking, playing Fall Guys through Creative is easier unless you're already familiar with UEFN. With that said, if you've never played Creative, you can access it by searching through the available modes in Fortnite, selecting it, and loading into the mode until you enter your world.
Screenshot by Destructoid
After entering your creative world's hub, you'll find a golden portal and a terminal. Interacting with this terminal lets you create and select new islands. Create a new island and select Fall Guys to see the list of starter islands. Choose any that look interesting before entering the golden portal to access your world.
Now, your character will look like a Fall Guys character, and you can play through premade obstacle courses. Alternatively, you can make your own using empty grids or modify the starter island to unleash your creativity.
As of now, this is the only way to play Fall Guys in Fortnite's 30.30 update. However, in 30.40, we'll see new additions to this collaboration, including the ability to play other people's Fall Guys island and cosmetics to fit the theme.

The only way to get Fall Guys skins in Fortnite before the collaboration officially begins on August 6 is to make a Creative island. By heading into your Creative world, finding the island terminal next to the teleportation portal, and making a Fall Guys island, your regular skin will convert to a small bean-like character you'd find in Fall Guys.

Make sure you're specifically choosing a Fall Guys starter island when making your new world. Picking any other template will cause your regular character to spawn in.

Nonetheless, even if you only keep the skin while on your island, you can use this to check out what your favorite skins look like as Fall Guys characters. For example, I was able to use my go-to character, Explorer Emilie, and see how she looks in this new form. You can do this with just about any skin to see how they change.

Fortnite's v30.30 update is full of wild and wacky additions, from a Fall Guys collaboration to the introduction of the Tesla Cybertruck. This famous Tesla car, in particular, is well known for its peculiar geometric design, making it a fun addition to have. Here's how to get the Tesla Cybertruck bundle in Fortnite.
How to get a free Cybertruck in Fortnite v30.30
Getting the Tesla Cybertruck in Fortnite requires completing Summer Road Trip quests, available from July 23 to August 6 when v30.40 releases. How to get the Cybertruck in Fortnite after August 6
If you miss the opportunity to get the Tesla Cybertruck during the Summer Road Trip, you can purchase it through Fortnite's premium shop starting August 6. However, while the Summer Road Trip is a free way to get the Cybertruck, buying it from the shop requires V-bucks, a paid currency. entry.title: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 hits Game Pass on July 24
entry.summary:
After quite a bit of waiting, a Call of Duty title is finally making its way to the Xbox subscription service. The series' most recent entry, Modern Warfare 3, is set to release on Game Pass on July 24, 2024.
Console, PC Game Pass, and Game Pass Ultimate users can access the hit title, including its campaign storyline and MW3 Zombies mode. You'll see the return of the elite Task Force 141 as they go on a mission to take down the notorious Vladimir Makarov.
Image via Activision
It's a great time to get into Modern Warfare 3 if you haven't already. MW3 and Warzone Season 5 will launch the same day as the Game Pass debut, featuring WWE Operators, events, and new maps. The release of Black Ops 6 is also on the horizon, and some rumors have suggested that this title will be the next up for the Game Pass.
With this GP launch, I wouldn't be surprised to see other Call of Duty entries make it to the Xbox service later on. There's certainly more than enough content to put on there, from the original Modern Warfare to the fan-favorite Black Ops 3. Plus, Call of Duty isn't the only Activision title to get a Game Pass integration, given that Blizzard's Diablo IV arrived on the service in March 2024. We should see more Activision titles coming to GP, both from past iterations and possible new releases.
However, Xbox Game Pass users will see an increase in subscription prices starting on Sept. 12. As reported by The Verge, Ultimate prices will go from $16.99 to $19.99, while PC Game Pass will change from $9.99 to $11.99. Since we're reaching August, you'll still have over a month to see these alterations happen.
As long as you have an active Xbox subscription, you can download Modern Warfare 3 on July 24. Additional seasons typically arrive each month, so get ready for some new ventures in the near future.

entry.title: CrowdStrike
Forestrike Is A Puzzle-Like Kung Fu Game By The Makers Of Olija
entry.summary:
Skeleton Crew, the team behind the 2021 side-scrolling action game Olija, and Devolver Digital have revealed an intriguing new project: Forestrike. The game sports a unique premise: as a martial artist, you can foresee and simulate future combat encounters, allowing you to perfect your execution before laying a finger on anyone.¬† The fighter battles to free a captive Emperor from an evil Admiral, and doing so involves mastering Foresight, a meditative technique to mentally predict and play out battles before they unfold (for Dragon Ball fans, think of image training). Gameplay-wise, players are pitted against different combinations of enemy types. They use Foresight to play the battle in advance to find the optimal approach to defeating them while taking little to no damage. For example, using Foresight may help you learn to dodge a charging enemy so they trample an ally, then finish him off by lobbing a nearby weapon.¬†Determining the best approach may take several Foresight attempts, but once you have your strategy down, you then execute the battle in real-time. After winning a fight, a replay feature allows you to rewatch it using slow-motion and other editing tools to study your strategy or generally feel cool about your performance.¬†
